intro: Pterocaulon alopecuroides var. salicifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf pterocaulon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in racemes, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its root system is well-developed, allowing it to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
